We acknowledge that a discussion of these matters is important, because our findings could influence the care of many patients.First, they indicate that Cohen and colleagues (1) did not confirm all fatal PEs with autopsy. They propose that this would overestimate the risk for such events. We included these events because, in accordance with our prespecified criteria, they were independently adjudicated as fatal PEs.Second, they questioned our decision to extract data from only the first 21 ...References1.
